Keywords: Armor , Asgardian , Avengers , Cosmic , Deity , Mystical , Stark Industries , Wakanda
Real Name: Odin Borson
Special Powers
MORE SONS THAN I CARE TO REMEMBER: FREE: Choose a character on your Sideline with the Asgardian keyword and choose a standard attack or defense power printed on their card. Iron All-Father can use the chosen power until your next turn.
STARK'S DESIGN, WAKANDAN VIBRANIUM, AND INFUSED DWARVEN MAGIC: Close Combat Expert, Exploit Weakness, Outwit, Probability Control.

November 23, 2022
The Darkstone
He's a monster in 300 sealed, but more of a for fun piece in regular play. I've had success in higher point games using Iron All Father at 300 with wkMP21-004 Invisible Woman to give out defend. Sharing a 20 is still solid.
November 23, 2022
pokolo
Even with all the powers he can potential have access to, I just feel no stop and no improved targeting makes this a hard sell as a OMA. Even the 125 point line seems too risky to play seriously.
June 22, 2022
DuvaJaro
Party Thor offers Invincible on the Sideline at Rare and The Executioner offers Steal Energy at common, so both of those are easier to field for those powers than Valkyrie and Thor. And Uncommon Thor offers Regeneration as well.
June 18, 2022
Disasstah
Here's a list of current modern figures as of the 2022 rotation that encompass all powers except Precision Strike, since no Asgardian has it printed on their card. I put () around powers unique to each character as there are a lot of overlapping powers. Click Post Comment to see a cleaner version of this list. wotr020 The Enchantress - (TK), (Poison), (Master Mind), ESD wotr049 Valkyrie - (Steal Energy), (Regen), Quake, BCF, Impervious, Invulnerability, msdp036 Sylvie - (Pulse Wave), BCF, Super Senses, Combat Reflexes msdp035 Loki - (PenBlast), (Barrier), ESD wotr056 Thor - (Super Strength), (Invincible), Quake, Impervious, Invulnerable msdp007 Loki - (Incapacitate), (Willpower), BCF, Combat Reflexes, Super Senses, wkMP21-004 Invisible Woman - (Defend) wotr041 Thunderstrike - (Energy Explosion), Invulnerability, Toughness, ESD If you just need basic defense powers to lower the sideline count: wotr024 Dr. Annabelle Riggs - ESD, Combat Reflexes wotr056 Thor - Invincible, Impervious, Invulnerability If you need basic attack powers: wotr049 Valkyrie - BCF, Quake, Steal Energy wotr031 Thor - Energy Explosion, Pen Blast
March 9, 2022
hoojeebo
When in doubt, and *especially* when responding about a rule, the Comprehensive Rulebook is always easily accessible online. No one needs to guess or surmise anything; just look it up.
March 8, 2022
shawn11189
[QUOTE=Coyote's Own;12186711]@ shawn11189 3 elements per 100 points. A 300 point force can include 9 elements on the sideline (Comprehensive rulebook p.06). And yes a Force must include at least one non-bystander character but does not need to contain more than one. You can make a force out of 1 300 point Iron All-Father and 9 Asgardians.[/QUOTE] Good to know I misremembered because I usually don’t use sideline pieces.
March 8, 2022
Coyote's Own
@ shawn11189 3 elements per 100 points. A 300 point force can include 9 elements on the sideline (Comprehensive rulebook p.06). And yes a Force must include at least one non-bystander character but does not need to contain more than one. You can make a force out of 1 300 point Iron All-Father and 9 Asgardians.
March 8, 2022
shawn11189
[QUOTE=BridgeGuy;12177610]In this set, common Executioner has Steal Energy. uncommon Thor #17 has Regen. I don't have the sideline rules in front of me. Can you put both of those on sideline of you use Allfather as 1-man Army? You have a decent chance of pulling this 3-figure combo in sealed, actually.[/QUOTE] My understanding of sideline and I could be wrong was that 1 character per every 100 points of the game build. So in a 300 point game you should be allowed 3 extra pieces. I don’t remember there being anything about it having to be multiple characters on your force.
February 11, 2022
JokerX81
I just used him at his 125pt line with Spider-Man and Angela for sideline (senses and combat reflexes) only thing that did him in was missing too many ss rolls.
January 27, 2022
Bat-Phreak
Echoing Goop, 300-pts is a lot especially "...With no stop clicks and no more than one attack per turn..." However, with a printed 20-DEF I would look more toward avoiding the hit rather than trying to reduce damage, since IA-F is +going+ to be out-Actioned. wotr020 The Enchantress has ESD to make your opponent hit a 22, 23 w/ Perplex and/or Hindering bonus, probably twice with PC, and is a good choice for Sideline. wotr060 Rocket Raccoon is going to be an important wing omnivore on the map as TOO COLD FOR YOU FUR-LESS WONDERS? could make it a bit more difficult for a brawler to get to Close Combat range with the Big O.
January 18, 2022
Goop
300 points is a lot. I'm also not thrilled that his exploit/cce special damage power is on his running shot clicks. Still though he hits crazy hard and has a large assortment of powers. I dont think he's worth 300pts though. With no stop clicks and no more than one attack per turn you could be getting better value from multiples of other stuff. I imagine you have to choose invincible as the standard power taken otherwise a few pen blasts will drop him quick enough. I like him better at lower line.
January 16, 2022
BridgeGuy
In this set, common Executioner has Steal Energy. uncommon Thor #17 has Regen. I don't have the sideline rules in front of me. Can you put both of those on sideline of you use Allfather as 1-man Army? You have a decent chance of pulling this 3-figure combo in sealed, actually.
January 15, 2022
Dalandow
Dino-Thor has both on his dial if you're playing Golden Age. The new SR Valkyrie also has both, if you need a modern legal piece.

Are there any Asgardians with Regen or Steal Energy? Those would be pretty handy for this guy to have access to.
